task_description: Facing the building to your North-East (approx. 61°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the top of the building to estimate its full height, so I will rotate my view upwards.
I still cannot see the top of the building, so I need to look up further to get a full view of its height.
I still can't see the top of the building, so I need to tilt my view up even more to see the roofline.
I have tilted up multiple times but still can't see the roof; I will try a larger upward rotation to get the full building in view.

Now that I can see the entire building from base to roof, I can estimate its height by counting the floors; it appears to be about 10 stories high, and assuming a standard height of 3 meters per story, the total height is approximately 30 meters.
